meanings.definition: To surpass in sulking or being sullen.
meanings.sent1: She outsulks her brother whenever she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: He always outsulks his friends when things don't go as planned.
meanings.sent3: The cat outsulks the dog when it doesn't get the attention it wants.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds outsulking the sun, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The grumpy old man outsulks everyone in the neighborhood with his constant frowns.

meanings.definition: To outdo in sulking or being moody.
meanings.sent1: The child outsulks all the other kids when he doesn't get his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She outsulks her classmates whenever she feels upset about something.
meanings.sent3: The cat outsulks the dog by hiding in a corner and refusing to come out.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds outsulking the clear sky, bringing a gloomy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The teenager outsulks everyone in the house with his constant grumbling and pouting.
